Title: Software Developer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Making learning better. How cool is it to have millions of people using your code everyday!
D2L is a cloud company that is modernizing education and building the Future of Work. The old models of teaching and learning are in the midst of the largest transformation in history, and D2L is at the heart of that fundamental shift.
New models of teaching and learning enable a personalized, student-centric experience – and deliver improved retention, engagement, satisfaction, and results for learners of all ages – in schools, campuses, and companies.
D2L is disrupting the way the world learns, by providing the next generation learning environment and solutions to engage and inspire learners. And most importantly, by giving customers a platform that is easy, flexible, and smart. No other company provides a solution as robust and innovative as D2L.
D2L’s has had a singular mission for 20 years and is dedicated to that same mission in the years ahead: to transform the way the world learns – and by doing so, we will help improve human potential globally.
How will I make an Impact?
We’re looking for experienced Software Developers who’ve been working three or more years in the tech field and who are passionate about developing software and employing engineering best practices. You’ll use your experience and know-how to enable teams to be more productive and effective through the code they write, the decisions they make, and the knowledge they share. Your ideas and perspectives are essential to making sure we’re building the right technology and effectively advancing our goals.
Love how you do it
You’ll work on an Agile development team which includes Developers, Test Developers, Designers, a Product Manager, and a Development Manager
Teams can tackle any problem in any area, ensuring exposure to a variety of problems and technologies
All members of the team contribute to the definition, requirements, development, and testing of the problems we are solving
Our team has many high potential junior members who would benefit from your strong technical mentorship
What is D2L looking for from me?
Your experience is important, but most of all we are looking for people who are quick to learn, passionate about what they do, and are eager to collaborate with others to create innovative products that will delight and inspire our users. In general, we are hoping:
You’re passionate about our users and are their advocates in the development process
You collaborate effectively, helping your teammates to grow and develop their technical and non-technical skills
Strong understanding of Computer Science topics, including data structures, algorithms, databases, and distributed systems
A body of work demonstrating a consistent ability to complete technical challenges
Familiarity or experience with at least some of the technology we use, including C#, Java, AWS, serverless applications, SQL and NoSQL databases, Java script, web components, Node.js
Bachelor’s degree or diploma in computer science, computer engineering or similar technical discipline
Why D2L Vancouver is awesome!
Flexible work hours and environment, currently allowing working from home and/or in the office
Brand new collaborative (and dog-friendly) office environment
Amazing views of Vancouver and harbor from dedicated top floor of historic Marine Building with private outdoor balconies
Central downtown location, close to transit hubs, restaurants, and pubs
Free secure bike parking and shower, with available (for extra charge) clothes dryers, full bike wash, and executive bike room
Diverse and friendly group that schedules time to socialize over cake and games
Foosball tables, video and board games
Education Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or diploma in computer science, computer engineering or similar technical discipline.

Title: Front End Developer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Aquanow is looking for a front end developer to join our technology team. This is a unique opportunity to work alongside a highly experienced team and contribute to the development of a high-growth blockchain technology company.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Contribute to the development of new web applications along with all features and major releases
Write code, conduct code reviews, and participate in peer code design discussions
Ensure code adheres to Company guidelines and industry standards
Ensure requirement are well defined and understood before writing any code
Work with the product and design team to understand end-user requirements and translate them into technical specification requirements
Keep up-to-date with latest industry trends in web technologies and understand how we can exploit them in our applications
Ensure projects are completed successfully on time
Ensure all code written have been successfully tested from unit, integration and end to end, making every effort to automate all the tests
Analyze needs and help turn those into concepts and then into reality
Collaborate with back-end developers and web designers to improve usability
Requirements:
At least 5 years of experience in software engineering and at least 3 years of experience in developing web apps and shipping user-facing features with JavaScript and modern, component-based JS frameworks like React
At least 2 years experience in React Native and built Build mobile-first front end interactive experiences in Reactjs
Experience in developing and shipping user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks
Familiar with current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability
Experience in scalable RESTful and GraphQL services using Node.js, Express and ES6+ Javascript
Ability to work with little supervision
Demonstrate great attention to detail and experience collaborating with UI/UX designers in an agile environment
Good verbal and written communication skills
About us
Aquanow is a trading and technology company powering the next generation of financial services. We provide 24x7 liquidity and infrastructure for digital assets. Our customer base is international and includes some of the world’s fastest growing fintech businesses and financial institutions.
Aquanow is privately-funded and guided by experienced trading professionals and financial executives.
More about Aquanow
At our offices you will find a group of people that embrace diversity and value performance over pedigree. Every day we draw value from the diverse experiences of our team whose backgrounds include top financial institutions, tech companies and untraditional backgrounds. Our success comes from identifying exceptional people and providing them with the platform to reach their true potential. Even if you feel you may not meet all the job requirements, we encourage you to apply.
Here are a few benefits that we are pleased to offer our full-time staff:
- Casual office culture and dress
- Extended healthcare and dental benefits
- Access to private on-site fitness facilities
- Complimentary healthy snacks, coffee, and beverages
- Professional development, mentorship and networking opportunities

Equisoft, a leading global provider of digital business solutions for the insurance and wealth industries, is actively seeking new talent!

Title: Full-Stack Web Developer - Work From Home Full Time! - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Work from home, anywhere in Canada!
Full time: 37.5h per week.
Here is a stellar opportunity to have a massive impact: join the rapidly growing team at a company continually redefining how people shop for their powersport needs. As a full-stack web developer at Revco.ca, you will be responsible for implementing new features we're adding to our systems, working on improving the shopping experience of our ever-expanding base of customers. This career will offer you demanding yet very rewarding responsibilities.
Our small but successful group of companies have continued to experience growth and our dedicated employees have been an integral part of its success. If you're reliable, proactive, trustworthy, positive and driven, we'd like to speak to you! This is your opportunity to learn and help Revco.ca rise to the top of the powersports industry.
What you’ll be doing
As part of a small group of three developers, your main responsibilities will be split into two main streams.
Custom web applications
- you will take part in creating a series of tools to help our employees and customers. This can range from a simple interface to manage customer orders, to a complete inventory management system with third party API integrations. As a passionate developer, you should be able to debug and provide solutions to complex problems.
E-commerce
- you will develop front-end features for our online store, providing a thoroughly enjoyable experience for our customers.
Working with us
This is a full-time permanent remote position, working Monday to Friday during core business hours, with flexibility. We’re offering an attractive annual salary of $70,000 - $85,000/year commensurate with experience, along with a complete benefits package.
We are a small team (roughly 20 people) of hard-working, respectful and friendly coworkers. We need someone who truly enjoys working in a company small enough to actually make a difference but big enough for job stability and structure.
What makes you an ideal candidate?
Excitement and passion for everything you’ve read so far will go a long way, but your success in this role will also depend on the following skills and experiences:
College or university diploma in a computer programming related field
Minimum 3 years of professional experience as a full-stack web developer
Strong PHP, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS skills
Strong knowledge of relational databases and MySQL queries
Knowledgeable debugger (using appropriate tools and techniques)
Experience with API integrations
Comfortable with Git commands, and branching/merging techniques
Bonus qualifications:
Experience with jQuery
Experience with Bootstrap
Server & database management
Expected start date: 2021-11-29
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $70,000.00-$85,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Casual dress
Dental care
Disability insurance
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
Life insurance
Paid time off
Store discount
Vision care
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Application question(s):
When are you available to start?
Experience:
full-stack development (after graduation): 3 years (required)
Work remotely:
Yes

Title: Front-End Developer - Remote - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Talkatoo is reinventing dictation software by modernizing the experience, making it easy to use, and ensuring it’s accessible everywhere. We are a fast-growing, funded startup working with industry-leading partners. Our motto is easy, efficient, and everywhere.
We are looking for a highly motivated, experienced Node.js developer to help take our desktop application to the next level. You will work closely with a small, close-knit team of developers, in a fast-paced environment. As an integral part of our growing team, your contributions will have a significant impact on the lives of our users, and the animals they care for. If the thought of taking a feature from idea to fully realized, functioning system sounds appealing, we want you to apply.
Every developer at Talkatoo is given the ability to choose where they work, how they work, and when they work. We’re looking for an open, honest, and driven individual to help take our digital offerings to the next level.
Responsibilities
Write tidy, performant, considerate, and maintainable code.
Take requirements and quickly turn them into working prototypes for feature validation.
Maintain and debug existing features on code.
Design and implement backend application logic and communication.
Implement customer-facing UI designs.
Work with the UX team and backend team to deliver new features for our users.
Contribute to code reviews and brainstorming sessions.
Qualifications
3 or more years of proven frontend development experience.
Deep understanding of Node.js.
Extensive knowledge of frontend technologies such as HTML5 and SASS.
Experience with Electron.
Experience using Vue.js is a plus.
Core Competencies
Ability to give accurate time estimates and good time management skills.
Highly motivated and driven to deliver on time.
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently.
This position is open to remote candidates with Canadian work authorization (Canadian citizen, permanent resident and/or appropriate work visa).

Title: Software Engineer (Co-Op) - January 2022 - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you a 3rd or 4th-year student with a passion for video games? Do you have the desire to help create compelling interactive experiences for our players? Are you excited by the idea of working with iconic franchises from the Pixar and Disney Universe? Well, we have the opportunity for you!
We are looking for aspiring Software Engineers to work with our experienced team of Engineers as part of a co-op program which begins in January and extends over a four (4) month term. During this time, you will work within a collaborative environment while gaining knowledge and first-hand experience in building Front End (Unity + Mobile) or Back End (NodeJS + Mongo) features. What you work on will be enjoyed by millions!
At Kabam, we’re constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play mobile gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that together as a team we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture and a drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come in…
Co-ops will have the opportunity to contribute to many areas of work, including:
With the support of existing programmers, understand given requirements, write code, pass code reviews, build a test and deployment plan and get your features live!
Act upon feedback from stakeholders to refine and hone features
Working closely with producers, designers and other programmers in a highly collaborative and agile environment
Other ad-hoc projects and/or requirements that may arise
We are looking for individuals who:
Are in 3rd or 4th year in a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent.
Are highly motivated with the drive to take on new challenges and problem-solving.
Have excellent communication skills, both verbally and written.
What will make you stand out:
Up-to-date understanding of the latest mobile gaming trends
Passion for mobile free-to-play games
Knowledge of object oriented languages (Either C#, and/or JavaScript are a BIG plus)
Knowledge of relevant environments (Unity, NodeJS, Google Cloud are a plus)
Strong understanding of both relational and non-relational databases is an asset
Experience working on game related projects is an asset
Together, we can create and support some of the best games ever made and continue to entertain the world!
About Kabam
Kabam is a world leader of developing entertaining, immersive, and highly social multiplayer games for mobile devices. They merge consumer behaviour with the art of game design to create experiences that are enjoyed by millions of players across the globe. Each game has raised the benchmark in mobile gaming, bringing high-quality graphics, next-generation technology and revolutionary gameplay to the console in every player’s pocket.
Kabam has partnered with leading entertainment brands like Disney, Hasbro and Universal to create mobile games based on some of the world’s most iconic franchises.
Kabam’s games have generated hundreds of millions of downloads including Fast & Furious 6: The Game, Fast & Furious: Legacy, Marvel Contest of Champions, Transformers: Forged to Fight, Shop Titans and Mini Guns. These games have also received multiple awards such as Apple’s Editor’s Choice and Google Play’s Best Game of the Year.
Founded in 2006, Kabam has studios and offices in Vancouver, Montreal, Charlottetown, San Francisco and Austin. Kabam is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Netmarble Games.
Kabam is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and equitable workplace, and inclusive environment for all existing and potential employees. Employment decisions are based on candidate qualifications and business need, not race, color, ancestry, place of origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, political belief, religion, creed, marital or family status, medical condition, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, prior criminal conviction or any other protected class in accordance with federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Front-end Developer - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
** This role can be done remotely from anywhere in Canada **
As a
Front-End Developer
, you will be responsible for customizing, developing and supporting the Pulse platform. You consider the technical side and the human side, the day-to-day and the big picture, guiding best practices and Traction’s values along the way.
Traction on Demand’s hiring philosophy is based on culture, intelligence, and then skills. Here’s what we mean by that:
Culture
Culture at Traction on Demand isn’t about drinking beer and playing ping-pong – it’s much more. We are looking for people who want to join an active community of engaged individuals who see business as more than just a vehicle to make money. We care about our people, wider community, and planet. Come join us on this journey! Traction is a group of entrepreneurs committed to creating ecstatic clients, doing enjoyable work, and being efficient in everything we do. We fail fast and love to innovate. Change is our middle name. Our values don’t just sit on a glossy page. We live by them every day. Our values are the cornerstone of who we are – do they resonate with you?
Embrace Knowledge • Do the right thing • Seek adventures and smiles • Healthy hearts and heads • Pursue opportunity • Build community
Intelligence
People often ask what it takes to succeed at Traction on Demand – you’ve got to be smart, without having an ego. What does that mean? Imagine working with a group of your smartest friends who all love to learn. Everyone is always pushing each other to grow and innovate at a pace that can only be called furious. We are never idle or stagnant. We seek and share knowledge. We are comfortable with the unknown. We just “git ‘r done.”
Skills
Tractionites come from a variety of backgrounds, and we are eager to find people that are from non-traditional backgrounds. Typically, we find that people are successful in this role when they have:
Computer Science Degree or equivalent experience
3-5 years’ development experience in Java, .NET or another C-style language through personal or work experience
Expert in front-end web development (e.g., JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Bootstrap etc).
Experience in NodeJS, JavaScript frameworks (e.g., Vue.js, React, Angular).
Experience with chrome extension development is a nice to have
Nice to haves: Chrome Browser Extensions, Mobile app dev, AWS Lambda, Jira, Machine Learning.
Exposure to Git.
Strong knowledge of relational databases and SQL
Ability to effectively communicate technical issues in laymen's terms to customers
Self-Motivated problem solver who loves getting their hands dirty debugging issues
Highly motivated with the ability to prioritize what’s on your plate
What You Will Be Doing
Working on AWS with cutting edge technology, such as serverless architecture and AI
Build a high-quality, robust product using various JavaScript libraries/frameworks
Developing APIs to be used internally and by customer integration processes
Customer data transformation and migration
Involvement in code reviews, sprint planning, and sharing ideas for continuous improvement via sprint retrospectives
If you’re interested, so are we! Send your resume our way, and we’ll reach out to you if we are interested in moving forward.
At Traction on Demand, we aim to change the world by challenging the traditional consulting model and building community with our clients, partners, and neighbours. At our core, we’re about improving the way companies do business by leveraging technology – salesforce.com, technology partners, and our own libraries of intellectual property. We are a people-first organization, creating long-term relationships with our clients and growing with them as strategic business partners. Our clients are varied in size, geography, and industry, and include some of the world’s largest technology firms. Traction for Good, our community engagement program, and our involvement as one of the first 100 B Corps in Canada are just a couple of the reasons why we have been named to the Best Places to Work in Canada top 10 list for several years running.
We are an equal opportunity employer and love diversity at our company! We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.
Please note, employment is contingent on the successful completion of background and reference checks.

Title: Backend Developer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
BBTV is a media-tech company advancing the world through the creation, distribution, management and monetization of content. We are the second-largest video property worldwide in terms of unique viewers following only Google, reaching tens of billions of impressions per month!
BBTV is a leader in the industry through our end-to-end solutions for content creators and content owners, which include our proprietary technology and software solutions. We have built proprietary VISO technologies leveraging machine learning, digital signal processing and big data to power our platform and ecosystem. Our key revenue streams represent the most relevant and scalable opportunities for monetization of digital IP across advertising, SaaS/content management, mobile apps and other revenue streams.
About the Role
We have an opening for a Backend Software Developer to become part of our growing R&D department. As part of our engineering team, you will leverage advanced and start-of-the-art technologies to develop a new generation of tools and products that help internal departments as well as content creators. You will assist with mentoring other team members and provide guidance on best practices within the department.
*
Key Responsibilities*
Work collaboratively on the design and implementation of BBTV’s Internal products and Big Data systems; manage the current and historical data for millions of videos, channels & other entities
Develop solutions using Python, Node and other modern development languages and frameworks
Work with the IT team to develop a data security and retention framework
Actively look for solutions to improve our workflow, technology and products
Continually expand your knowledge of technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies, and software development best practices
Assist with mentoring other team members on best practices
A strong candidate will have
Minimum 2 years experience building professional backend applications, including demonstrated expertise in planning and design
Experience with Python and distributed systems
Experience in designing and building applications which enable high levels of concurrency
Proven experience with SQL queries and functions
Knowledge and understanding of data architecture, integration and data modelling techniques
Understanding of data storage paradigms, including relational and denormalized databases
Understanding of data storage strategies, including sharding and denormalized indexing
Experience in requirements engineering, data architecture, design, development and deployment
Experience with data warehousing (especially Snowflake), ETL and related techniques & technologies is a plus
Experience with modern cloud-based architecture leveraging AWS components and Docker
A Degree in Computer Science or a related field is a plus
About BBTV
At BBTV, our team is everything. We offer competitive compensation packages and have a strong focus on diversity, inclusiveness and equitable compensation. We also offer flexible hours and operate on a horizontal management structure that rewards creativity and values transparency.
From our commitment to giving back (support for everyone to volunteer with a charitable or community initiative), our culture committee (social events, team-building, diversity and inclusion), and our support for personal and career development through our learning & development program, we’re not your typical 9-5 gig.
BBTV is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our goal is to foster a diverse workforce that is representative, at all job levels, of the individuals we serve and to provide employees with a meaningful and inclusive work environment, free of discrimination and harassment.
BBTV believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates are critical to our success as a global company. We seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Indigenous people, people of colour, people of all genders or non-genders, and people with disabilities of all types are encouraged to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
To all recruitment agencies, BBTV does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, BBTV employees or any other company location. BBTV is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: QA Programmer - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description
As a QA Programmer at Ubi MTL, you will create automated tests and validation tools to make QA an integral part of the game development life cycle.
You believe in working efficiently and testing thoroughly to achieve quality. Always on the lookout for ways to improve processes, you develop automated solutions that help production teams – in every department – take a proactive approach to quality assurance. You aim to ensure that features are validated consistently, so that bugs and glitches can be corrected now, prevented later, and never reach our players.
What you’ll do
Collaborate with team leads to understand their tasks, analyze workflows, and look for areas of improvement.
Develop and implement custom tests and tools.
Create and maintain documentation to serve as reference to guide interdependent teams.
Train production team members on how to use your automated products + raise awareness of new processes.
Follow up on your tests and tools to provide support and resolve problems.
Come up with solutions to continuously optimize the QA process.
Stay up to date on testing best practices and technological advancements to keep up with the industry + develop your skills and refresh your knowledge.
Qualifications
What you bring
Experience in software QA or engineering (or other relevant experience)
Knowledge of programming languages (C++, Python, HTML, CSS, C#), Visual Studio, bug tracking software (e.g. Jira), 3D software (e.g. 3DS Max), game engines (e.g. Unity or Unreal) & their limitations
A solid understanding of QA methodologies, processes, and tools
A degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering (or related training)
A highly collaborative, empathetic, creative, and innovative spirit
Excellent critical thinking, organizational, problem-solving, communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills
Curiosity, resourcefulness, and plenty of flexibility
Motivation to reach out for feedback and adapt to it
Just a heads up: If you require a work permit, your eligibility may depend on your education and years of relevant work experience, as required by the government.
What to send our way
Your CV, highlighting your background and skills
A real live person will review your application. In this case, it’s our talent acquisition specialist Alison. As she learns more about you through your profile, get to know her through the video below.
Additional Information
About us
Creating the unknown since 1997. At Ubisoft Montreal, we’re united by a common goal: to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. We develop iconic franchises that engage millions around the world, like Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry, For Honor, Rainbow Six, Watch Dogs – and, well, we can’t disclose all our secrets just yet.
Our biggest strength is – and always will be – our people: the immensely talented team members surrounding, supporting, and producing the high-quality games that have made our studio what it is today.
When you join Ubi MTL, you’ll discover a workplace that sparks inspiration and connection: an environment with a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We offer a collaborative space that provides career advancement, a host of learning opportunities, and meaningful benefits centred on well-being.
Here, our shared desire to dream big, take risks, and constantly improve contributes to the innovation and boundary-pushing that ultimately leads to our collective success.
At Ubisoft, you can come as you are. We embrace diversity in all its forms. We’re committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Software Engineer - Graduate - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job ID:
103711
Required Travel
:No Travel
Managerial - No
Who are we?
If you’re a smartphone user then you are part of an ever more connected and digital world. At Amdocs, we are leading the digital revolution into the future. From virtualized telecommunications networks, Big Data and Internet of Things to mobile financial services, billing and operational support systems, we are continually evolving our business to help you become more connected. We make sure that when you watch a video on YouTube, message friends on Snapchat or send your images on Instagram, you get great service anytime, anywhere, and on any device. We are at the heart of the telecommunications industry working with giants such as AT&T, Vodafone, Telstra and Telefonica, helping them create an amazing new world for you where technology is being used in amazing new ways every single day.
In one sentence
Responsible for design, develop, modify, debug and/or maintain software systems.
This is an excellent opportunity for a new GRADUATE!
What will your job look like?
You will design, develop, modify, debug and/or maintain software code according to functional, non-functional and technical design specifications.
You will follow Amdocs software engineering standards, applicable software development methodology and release processes, to ensure code is maintainable, scalable, supportable and demo the software products to stakeholders
You will investigate issues by reviewing/debugging code, provides fixes and workarounds, and reviews changes for operability to maintain existing software solutions.
You will work within a team, collaborate and add value through participation in peer code reviews, provide comments and suggestions, work with cross functional teams to achieve goals.
You will assume technical accountability for your specific work products within an application and provide technical support during solution design for new requirements.
You will be encouraged to actively look for innovation and continuous improvement, efficiency in all assigned tasks.
All you need is...
Bachelor's degree in Science/IT/Computer Science or equivalent
Java experience (server side) on Linux/Unix/Windows
Demonstrable experience with the Spring framework components - Spring Boot, MVC, Integration, ‎Security, etc.‎
Experience in Unit Testing using tools like Junit & TestNG, and mocking tools like ‎Mockito/Power mock.‎
Preferred working experience in NoSQL databases.‎
Knowledge in message queue such as ActiveMQ, Kafka or RabbitMQ.‎
Knowledge with version control tools like Git and Bitbucket.‎
Knowledge of software best practices like Refactoring and Clean Code
Exposure to Agile/Scrum and TDD
Experience with Continuous Integration(Jenkins), Continuous Deployment, Static Code ‎Analysis (SonarQube)‎
Exposure to cloud and containerization.‎
Why you will love this job:
You will be challenged with design and develop new software applications
You will have the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with ever growing opportunities for personal growth
You will have the opportunity to work with the industry most advanced technologies
Amdocs is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce

Title: BI Developer - Sherbrooke, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
LIFE AT BRP
We create innovative ways to move – on snow, water, asphalt. In the air, on the ground and everywhere in between.
Built on a 75-year tradition of ingenuity and intensive customer focus, BRP is headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec and operates manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, and Austria. We have a total workforce of more than 14 500 driven, resourceful people.
Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex, Stacer and Savage boats, Evinrude and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts, motorcycles and recreational aircraft. We support our lines of product with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business to fully enhance your riding experience.
Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.
We are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve within an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.
www.brp.com.
Are you ready to be part of a dynamic team in charge of BRP’s supply chain strategy and finished goods distribution network? Based out of BRP’s centre of expertise, the team has a primary mission to ensure the highest quality transportation service for raw materials and finished goods while optimizing logistics costs. The team is also responsible for contributing to product development activities and manufacturing strategy, as well as supporting transportation operations teams in various tactical and strategic matters.
WHY JOIN THE TEAM?
The logistics strategy team is making greater use of business intelligence to drive decision making and improve management processes. We are therefore looking to hire a BI Developer who will help us develop dashboards and integrate data flows.
You will tackle a wide range of exciting challenges with a position key to BRP’s processing, innovation and continuous improvement activities.
You will play a key role in integrating business intelligence into supply chain operations.
You will work closely with various multidisciplinary teams throughout the world.
YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
In collaboration with the BI team, help develop and implement corporate data solutions.
Coordinate the collection, formalization and documentation of the organization’s corporate and sectoral data solution needs.
Collaborate with other IT professionals and communicate with various partners to clarify and understand their needs.
Participate in data processing, conversion and correction activities.
Participate in or conduct tests at various levels of detail, whether functional or technical.
Set up automatic data flows from various sources to Power BI.
Create reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Participate in ongoing solution publication and validate concepts with teams from various business units.
Conduct, document and validate requested analyses.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in Power BI and programming
Proficiency with the front end and back end of the Power BI office suite and the cloud platform.
Extensive experience designing and optimizing data flows for large volumes of structured and semi-structured data
Experience developing data warehouses and in modelling and/or data analysis
Solid knowledge of automation and data management, data integration, and database development techniques (Power Automate, Snowflake, SQL, Google BigQuery)
Proficiency with SQL, DAX, R and Python
Sense of initiative and desire to excel, ability to work independently, well organized, curious and thorough
Ability to adapt to ever-changing business demands
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
Skilled at working in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams
Knowledge of SAP (WM, MM, PP) an asset
Advanced bilingualism, both written and spoken (English/French), Spanish (an asset)
Familiarity with one of the following:
PRINCE2, Agile, Waterfall or BPMN (an asset)
Experience with supply chain and logistics (an asset)

Title: Software Engineer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
We’d love to hear from you if you are looking for a tech company with the following:
Huge market
($800 billion market size), we are building the first AI-powered super app to help people own a car;
Innovative product
with the combination of cutting edge mobile, AI and big data technologies;
Open, transparent,
merit-based culture;
- Hyper growth -
10X revenue growth
in 2020;
Best user experience:
#1 ranked app
in the insurance comparison category;
Strong leadership: from Amazon, Microsoft, Facebook, Nvidia, Alibaba, etc. and rockstar colleagues.
A few examples of the exciting projects that we are working on:
Create a smart prediction engine for customer’s insurance coverage needs
Build predictive models on customer purchase behavior based on a large data set
Use telematics tracking to build customer driving risk profile
About YOU:
You love tackling convoluted problems and coming up with clean, stable solutions that scale.
You have a genuine passion for designing and implementing elegant software solutions.
You are intimately familiar (and up to date) with the development ecosystem and make sound decisions when choosing the right tool or library for the job.
You will contribute across the entire product stack, as well as collectively oversee the integrity of the codebase.
A few more specifics about YOU:
1 + years of full-time software development experience.
B.S. degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Strong software development fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, etc.).
Proficient with modern web application development with knowledge of JS ecosystems and open source web frameworks (e.g. NodeJS / React / GraphQL / PostgreSQL / Redshift / Redis / Kubernetes).
Knowledge of good practices, preferred design patterns, and writing idiomatic Javascript code.
Solid understanding of performance implications and scalability of code.
Keenness for writing good, meaningful tests and maintaining thorough test coverage.

About Jerry:
Jerry is building the first Super App to save car owners time and money on all their car expenses. Drivers deserve better. That’s why we’re committed to making shopping for insurance, financing, maintenance, repairs, parking and more just a few clicks, texts, or swipes away.
Jerry is taking processes that haven’t substantively changed in decades and reimagining and redesigning them. Using artificial intelligence, machine learning and bots, Jerry eliminates the need for long forms and phone calls while providing personalized services for all car-owners’ needs.
Today, Jerry is the #1 rated and most downloaded app in its category and the fastest way to compare and buy car insurance. We have more than 1M customers and we are just getting started. Join our team of curious and passionate people who love tackling real-world problems and be a part of building a revolutionary product that’s disrupting a massive market.
Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $130 million in financing.

Title: Robotics Web Developer Co-op - Waterloo, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Position:
Robotics Web Developer (Co-op)
Location:
Waterloo, Ontario
Education:
Candidate for degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline
Division:
Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions
About Clearpath Robotics Inc.
Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.
About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions
Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.
About the Job:
As a Robotics Web Developer, you will create web applications that help engage potential customers during the sales process and that help reduce the load on the Sales team. Whereas every robot sale currently requires an email exchange with a member of the Sales team, you will develop a web application that allows potential customers to “Build & Price” our robots in real time, including a variety of optional features, similar to the way new cars can now be ordered online. We have a rough prototype of the application for our Dingo robot, but there is still a lot of work to improve the UI and to integrate the application with our business systems. As time permits, you will also generate a model of the customer-configured robot that can be used by the customer to begin simulation work.
Responsibilities include:
Use React, JavaScript, and Python to develop a web application for building and pricing CPR robots
Work with the Engineering team to develop 3D models of the robots and optional components in a manner suitable for the web application
Work with the Marketing and Sales teams to integrate the web application with existing business systems
Work with the Marketing team to integrate the web application into our existing website
Design the overall system so that we can maintain the Build & Price tools by adding new robots, adding new sensors, and updating prices
Skills and Experience:
Candidate for degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline
Experience with creating web applications using React and JavaScript
Well-organized and detail oriented
*
Bonus points for: *
Experience with web applications that connect to existing business systems such as Salesforce and Pardot
Experience with the use of 3D models in web applications, like threeJS or Unity
Experience with Python, ROS, or Gazebo
Having worked with a robot before

Title: Full-Stack Dev - Alma, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Salut, je suis JP, fondateur de Metrics Watch. Je vais être ton narrateur pour cette offre d’emploi!
Metrics Watch cherche sa première ou son premier dev à temps plein! (
à part moi
)
Metrics Watch?
Metrics Watch est une plateforme en ligne (SaaS) de rapport marketing. Elle se démarque de ses compétiteurs en étant
email-based
. Il y a aussi une fonctionnalité d'alertes Google Analytics en temps réel.
Des compagnies de partout dans le monde utilisent Metrics Watch: petites et grandes, dont Greyhound, Lindt, onvista et plusieurs autres.
En tant que première personne à temps plein au dev...
...tu vas avoir un impact majeur sur les projets et fonctionnalités. Tu auras beaucoup d’autonomie et d’impact sur les choix et l’architecture.
On travaillera ensemble pour faire de Metrics Watch une plateforme encore meilleure pour nos clients en ajoutant de nouvelles fonctionnalités, en bonifiant celles en places et avec des projets de R&D pour développer Metrics Watch à un autre niveau.
Tu auras une très grande liberté, sans être laissé à toi-même.
Mais encore?
Bonne question! Quoiqu’un peu floue.
Je vais assumer que tu veux entendre parler du
stack
techno un peu. Je me trompe?
Metrics Watch est une application web principalement bâtie en Ruby on Rails avec React pour certaines portions. Nous avons aussi d’autres applications en Node et Golang, mais le gros du travail se fait sur l’application Ruby on Rails. Le tout avec PostgreSQL et hébergé sur Heroku.
On a une bonne couverture de tests automatisés qui donne beaucoup de confiance lorsque vient le temps d'intégrer de nouveaux changements et le tout est déployé automatiquement en production par CI&CD.
“
Cool -- et je vais faire quoi au jour le jour?
”
Ça passera entre autres par (ça, c’est la section “tâches”):
Ajouter des nouvelles fonctionnalités (intégrations Google Sheets, templates et widgets préétablis, rendre la création de rapports plus flexible, découper le rendu des rapports actuel afin de rendre le tout disponible via un API et une couche de rendu, ce qui permettra la génération de rapport par courriel, le web et potentiellement d’autres plateformes de distribution, etc)
Régler des bugs (
hé oui, on ne fait pas exception, on a parfois des bugs!
)
Mettre à jour nos outils
Participer à la vision et la définition du produit
Ok, je suis partant.e. Y’a autre chose à savoir?
La section “exigences” ressemblerait à ceci:
Tu es intéressé.e par le monde des startups web et du SaaS.
Expérience en dev full stack, mais PAS nécessairement d’expérience avec notre
stack
.
Bon niveau d'anglais
Tu es à l’aise dans un contexte de communication à distance et asynchrone.
Tu es friand.e d’autoapprentissage, i.e. tu n’as pas peur d’utiliser Google (ou DuckDuckGo, etc.).
Si tu as encore des questions, tu peux me contacter par courriel sans problème!
Pourquoi travailler chez Metrics Watch?
Apprentissages accélérés de la réalité de startup tech
Petite équipe de 3 personnes où vous aurez un impact direct et majeur sur les décisions et la planification
Flexibilité de l'horaire et du lieu de travail
Équilibre travail / vie perso
Vacances dès la première année
Emplacement
: où vous voulez — aucune obligation présentielle, mais possibilité d'avoir un bureau à Alma.
Horaire
: temps plein, très flexible (travaillez où vous voulez, quand vous voulez)
Salaire
: 45-68k
Statut
: temps plein / permanent
Début visé
: Novembre.
Un peu plus sur l'entreprise…
Metrics Watch est une entreprise autofinancée (
bootstrapped).
Aucun financement externe ne nous dicte une direction. Nous sommes maîtres de nos décisions.
Actuellement constitué d'un fondateur (JP Boily), un gars au marketing à temps plein depuis la mi-octobre 2021 (
oui, c’est dans le futur, au moment d’écrire ces lignes
) et un designer à temps partiel.
JP Boily (fondateur) a travaillé à distance pour des startups américaines avant que le télétravail ne soit commun. Dans un premier temps, pour Gracious Eloise (acquis depuis), qui était une compagnie de réplication d'écriture basée à New York City. Dans un deuxième temps, pour Rainforest QA (YC S12), une compagnie d’automatisation d’assurance qualité, basée à San Francisco. En tant que 2e employé (mais premier à distance) et ensuite Engineering Manager où il a bâti une équipe distribuée dans plusieurs pays (Pérou, Brésil, Autriche, USA, etc).
Date limite de candidature : 2021-10-29
Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, Permanent
Salaire : 45 000,00$ à 68 000,00$ par an
Avantages :
Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
Horaires flexibles
Travail à Distance
Horaire :
Du Lundi au Vendredi

Habitez-vous au Canada et êtes-vous autorisé à y travailler?

DEC (Souhaité)
Langue:
Français (Obligatoire)
Anglais (Obligatoire)

Title: Software Engineer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
Patron Technology is a remote-friendly company. This position is open to any candidate in North America. Additionally, we have engineering teams in Pittsburgh, Tampa, Montreal and Dallas.
SO, WHO ARE WE?
Patron Technology empowers event organizers to take control of their entire event experience with our technology solutions. Using our powerful ticketing, experiential marketing, mobile apps, and cashless products, organizers transform how audiences experience their events, drive nonstop engagement, and reach new audiences around the world. That’s why iconic brands like New York Comic Con, Coachella, Candytopia, NHL, and Dreamforce use our suite of integrated event technology to power their events.
Sounds interesting? Let’s talk.
WHY DO WE NEED YOU?
ShowClix
, a product of Patron Technology, is actively seeking a Software Engineer with a passion for solving unique problems, wearing many hats, and working in a fast paced environment. The Software Engineer's job duties will include working with a team of developers to expand the ShowClix ticketing and event management platform.
AS A SOFTWARE ENGINEER, YOU WILL:
Develop an industry-leading event ticketing and management platform
Write maintainable and well-tested code
Help implement high-quality and long-lasting solutions to complex problems facing event organizers
Help critique and provide feedback on architecture and implementation of projects
Help refine tasks and estimates while participating in sprint planning sessions, standups, and retrospectives
Write software used at-scale by world-renowned event brands
EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:
2-4 years professional experience preferred
Strong understanding of PHP, Javascript and MySQL
Industry experience writing and maintaining software
Strong understanding of modern software design practices
Ability to write organized, legible, testable and efficient software
Comfortable around a command line in a Linux flavored environment
Understanding of web and network security
Eagerness to learn and willingness to take initiative to solve problems
Communication and writing skills
BONUSES:
Experience using React Javascript Framework
History of contributing to open source software
Ability to demonstrate professional expertise with writing, blog posts, talks, or other public work
Pragmatic machine learning experience
Having an affinity for bullet-point lists
LEARN MORE!
We offer medical, dental, vision, generous PTO, 401 K Savings plan, paid parental leave (following 12 months of continuous employment), and more.
For more information on Patron Technology’s solutions visit our website at https://patrontechnology.com
About ShowClix
ShowClix is a product of Patron Technology. ShowClix is a fast-growing, full-service event technology company that handles ticket sales, marketing, and on-site operations for events around the world. Our partners include fandom and consumer conventions, live music venues, museums, attractions, and festivals. Each of our team members is passionate about live events and innovative technologies.

Title: Application Developers - Surrey, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Healthcare Web Application Developers
Cambian is driven by a vision of a healthcare system that engages individuals and their families.
With this collaborative approach, individuals achieve better health and better healthcare, care
providers benefit from improved productivity and reduced costs, and researchers can access
essential data and achieve important discoveries. Everyone benefits when we include
individuals and their families as partners in care and research.
Exceptional opportunities
If you want to solve challenging problems, deliver high-impact solutions to customers, employ
leading-edge technologies, work with extraordinary people, and be part of a rapidly growing
company, Cambian is for you! We are looking for self-motivated energetic individuals with
passion for excellence and creativity to join our team.
The role: Application Developer
We are recruiting candidates for several positions in design, development, deployment, and
sustainment of our products. In this role you will:
Be a member of a scrum-based development team that designs, builds, and sustains products
Write and test code and release the resulting improved products
Work closely with product owners, software architects, and user experience designers
Participate in the design of new applications using rapid prototyping techniques
Lay the groundwork for new application development and frameworks by helping to select
leading-edge technologies
What you bring to the team
We look for smart, curious, engaged developers who can build great software products. We
value teamwork and the willingness to learn from others. Your experience should include:
Skilled in Java, XML, SQL
Experience developing Web applications
Talent for developing easy-to-use Web interfaces with HTML and JavaScript
Integration with 3rd party systems
Design and administration of relational databases
Design of multi-tier enterprise class business systems
Experience with Agile development methodologies
Excellent troubleshooting, planning and time management skills
Able to work in a team environment
Excellent English written and oral communication skills
Focused, analytical, results-oriented, and able to complete work in a timely, precise manner
Bachelors, Masters, or PhD in computer science or an engineering/scientific discipline
Additional desirable skills, abilities, and credentials include:
Healthcare domain expertise including relevant applications, standards, and technologies
jQuery, HTML5 and client-side JavaScript MVC frameworks such as Backbone.js
Mobile Web application development
Continuous integration
Deployment automation
Build management
Operational support
The bottom line is that we are looking for a range of skills. If you do not have the entire list, we
will provide training.
What we offer you
We offer a dynamic workplace, competitive compensation, and room for growth in an
emergent company. In our environment things move quickly so there is a lot to do and you will
have the opportunity to contribute in many ways. We offer a casual work environment with
flexible work hours.
Cambian’s main office is in Surrey, BC in the Central City tower next to the SFU campus, Fraser
Health, and the heart of Innovation Boulevard. This is a great location with easy access from
many parts of the BC Lower Mainland. Our open concept office space has lots of natural light
and fosters collaboration and teamwork. We are walking distance to many restaurants and the
SkyTrain public transit.
During the COVID-19 pandemic we have closed our office and we continue to encourage team
members to work from home. The candidate will require a computer at home and the ability to
communicate regularly via web conferencing platforms.
About us
Cambian is a leading digital healthcare information services provider. Individuals and their
families use Cambian’s platform to capture and use their health and wellness data, and to
securely share it with their family and care providers. Cambian’s platform is used by leading
institutions in Canada, USA, and Europe and for national initiatives to solve key problems in the
diagnosis and treatment of chronic disease.
Response Information
If you are interested in this opportunity, please send your resume to jobs@cambian.com.
Shortlisted candidates will be invited to an interview, and we may ask you for a copy of your
transcripts, examples of your work, and references.
We are currently hiring for several positions and we will fill the positions as we identify good
candidates. Please apply today!

Title: Software Developer Intern, AI@Unity - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
The opportunity
The AI@Unity Engine Performance team is looking for a multifaceted Software Developer Intern whose core objective is to build cross-platform, performance frameworks and libraries to support Unity's verticals in auto, industrial and game development!
As a member of the AI@Unity team, you will work with groundbreaking tools and new technologies to build content, enable storytellers and advance AI!
What you'll be doing
Collaborate with our platform teams (Mobile, Console, Desktop and Special Platforms) to investigate, review and update engine code
Develop integrations with applications, development frameworks, and libraries to support industry verticals in auto, industrial and film
Partner with platform teams and owners to coordinate feature development and ensure accurate functionality across platforms
Build and maintain tests to ensure quality
What we're looking for
Knowledge of C/C++, C#
Multithreading experience
Developed using graphics APIs (OpenGL, Vulkan, DirectX)
Cross-Platform experience iOS, Android, Mac, Windows
Currently enrolled in a Canadian Post-Secondary Institution, graduating December 2022 or in 2023.

Knowledge of Unity Engine, 3D simulators, game development and graphics
Academic or professional experience in Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Computer Vision
Experience working on developer tools, APIs, performance-minded development and large codebases
Life at Unity
Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.
Unity is at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.
Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Title: Software Developer Co-Op - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Trend Micro, a global leader in cybersecurity, is passionate about making the world safe for exchanging digital information today and in the future. Artfully applying our XGen™️ security strategy, our innovative solutions for consumers, businesses, and governments deliver connected security for data centers, cloud workloads, networks, and endpoints.
Optimized for leading environments, including Amazon Web Services, Microsoft®️, and VMware®️, our layered solutions enable organizations to automate the protection of valuable information from today’s threats. Our connected threat defense enables seamless sharing of threat intelligence and provides centralized visibility and investigation to make organizations their most resilient.
With over 6,500 employees in 50 countries and the world’s most advanced global threat research and intelligence, Trend Micro enables organizations to secure their connected world. www.trendmicro.com
As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, our platform delivers central visibility for better, faster detection and response and a powerful range of advanced threat defense techniques optimized for environments, like AWS, Microsoft, and Google.
Position Summary:
Within the Cloud One R&D team at Trend Micro, you will participate as part of a dynamic and talented team that develops the next generation of Trend Micro's security products. The Cloud One team is comprised of highly effective small teams that take ownership for various areas of our product and services. The teams work hard innovating to make the best darn software imaginable.
Your role will be to design, implement and test high quality software capabilities for data center and cloud based systems using your excellent coding abilities. This is a software development role requiring exceptional programming skills and a high degree of adaptability and creativity. If you love writing beautiful, efficient, and productive code, and have a desire to see your code deliver great value, we want to talk to you.
What Sets Us Apart:
Trend provides opportunities to pursue personal growth, training and continued development
Employees are encouraged to thrive, fail safely, learn from mistakes and grow
Use of innovative technologies like Cloud, Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes and DevOps
Frequent team activities, project celebrations and knowledge sharing
Regular Hack Days!
Global company, global opportunities
We're looking for someone who:
Will use their exceptional development skills primarily in Java to build innovative and sustainable solutions that solve customer problems. Expertise in C and C++ would be an asset.
Loves to work on a great cross functional team collaborating effectively with various groups to understand business objectives, customer needs and gaps, and deliver on the team objectives

Title: Robotics Test Developer Co-op - Waterloo, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Position:
Robotics Test Developer (Co-op)
Location:
Waterloo, Ontario
Education:
Candidate for BASc in Mechatronics or Systems Engineering or related discipline
Division:
Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions
About Clearpath Robotics Inc.
Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.
About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions
Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.
About the Job:
As a Robotics Test Developer, you will help bring our industry-leading autonomous Outdoor Navigation system to a higher level of performance by ensuring that it works robustly in a range of rugged environments. You will work with the Engineering team that is building the Outdoor Navigation system to design and execute tests, beginning with simulation and progressing to on-robot tests. As needed, you will create electromechanical fixtures or robot modifications to support the testing. In designing and executing these tests, you will have a chance to leverage your software, electrical, and mechanical engineering skills. This role will require a combination of indoor (remote) work as well as in-person field testing in and around the Kitchener-Waterloo area (transportation provided). Through your work, you will be enabling the use of robotics to replace today’s dull, dirty, and dangerous jobs.
Responsibilities include:
Developing and executing tests in simulation for Outdoor Navigation using C++ and Python
Defining and executing on-robot tests for Outdoor Navigation based on our client use cases
Creating automated tests for software functions and for the entire autonomous mobile robot system
Maintaining the robot test fleet including debugging and resolving electrical and mechanical issues on the robot under test
Designing and creating electrical and mechanical fixtures, performing robot sensor and hardware integration to support the on-robot tests
Generating reports on system performance and bugs identified
Skills and Experience:
*
Candidate for BASc or MASc in Engineering with software and robotics experience or equivalent
Experience with creating basic mechanical fixtures and jigs in a tool such as SolidWorks
Demonstrated experience with C++ and or Python
Well-organized and detail oriented
Willingness to assist with field (outdoor) testing in winter
*
Bonus points for: *
Experience with robotics systems and sensors
Experience with ROS
Experience with basic electrical and mechanical systems integration
Work in field robotics, deploying robot systems outdoors in remote and/or challenging environments.
At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact
1-800-301-3863

Title: Dev and Planning Technolgist - Stony Plain, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Information
Job Requisition ID: 19294
Ministry: Transportation
Location: Stony Plain
Full or Part-Time: Full Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Ongoing
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: November 24, 2021
Classification: Technologist 6
About Us
Alberta Transportation’s mandate is to ensure the transportation system enables Alberta’s economic, social and environmental vitality. With Alberta Transportation, you can engage in a fulfilling career with diverse room to grow. We believe in building careers, providing opportunities for growth within the organization, and strive to provide our staff with a work-life balance.
Role
Are you looking for a challenging opportunity to use your technical skills in a dynamic environment? Are you ready to progress in your land-use planning career? Alberta Transportation has an opportunity for you as Development and Planning Technologist located in the Stony Plain Office.
In this role, you will review and make recommendations on submissions for provincial highway vicinity activities, including subdivisions, developments, utility crossings, land dispositions, road closure procedures, special events, and sign installations. You will be responsible for ensuring safety guidelines are followed and that developments adhere to the long-term goals and plans of the department. You will also conduct field inspections and assist in the preparation of various agreements and plans.
You will be the first line of contact for the general public, developers, municipalities, planning board representatives, and other stakeholders on development issues; therefore, it requires strong relationship building, communication and negotiation skills. Originality and creativity are needed to provide solutions that allow highway area activities to proceed without compromising safety and long term highway planning objectives.
You will join a dedicated and dynamic team of engineering professionals and technologists willing to provide you support and training to broaden your technical knowledge and skills as you embark on your career with the public service.
The activities and responsibilities associated with this position are :-
1. Review and respond to applications/submissions for Roadside Permit, Utility Permit and Sign Permit.
2. Subdivision and planning proposals for Area Structure plan, Subdivision appeals, future highway planning.
3. Activities within highway right of way that includes Access management, filed inspections, sign approvals, traffic accommodation strategies.
4. Approval outside highway rights of way that includes road closures, property dispositions, property purchase.
Qualifications
A university degree in engineering, planning or applied sciences in a related field plus four years experience OR a technical diploma in civil engineering, land-use planning, land management or a related field plus six years of related experience in highway roadside planning, highway design and/or highway construction is required. Direct experience in development control and planning would be considered an asset.
Equivalency will be considered on one to one basis.
APS Competencies
Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.
The link below will assist you with understanding competencies:
The competencies required to succeed in this position are :
1. Systems Thinking
2. Creative problem Solving
3. Drive for Results
Salary
$2,621.67 to $3,442.53 bi weekly i.e. ( $68,425 to $89,850 per year )
Notes
This is a permanent position based in Stony Plain which is a town in the Edmonton Metropolitan Region of Alberta. This place is known for its many painted murals representing various periods, events and people throughout the town's history. Visit the Stony Plain website at
Travel is required in this position (Upto 25%) so candidates must possess a valid driver’s license.
Links and information on what the GoA has to offer to prospective employees.

Mojow was incorporated in February 2020. Our mission is to streamline on-farm operations, through innovative digital technologies and artificial intelligence, to help build a sustainable agriculture industry. Our main office and software development team is located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. Mojow Autonomous Solutions Inc. develops digital technology for agriculture. We work with farmers to
Improve the efficiency and effectiveness of farming operations
Ease collaboration
Successfully deploy autonomous farm machinery
The technology developed by Mojow will provide a unique mix of stand-alone digital products for sale within the agriculture market.
We are passionate about delivering quality products. We embrace change and follow agile development practices.
Job description
We are looking for mobile application developers to help develop a React Native application. We give people the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and teamwork.
If you are passionate about customer-focused software development, apply to join our team!.
What you'll be doing
Software architecture design,
Rapid software prototyping,
Work as part of a small team to build full stack applications with React Native iOS / Android frontends,
Implement pixel perfect user interfaces that match design mockups,
Integrate third-party and internal APIs,
Release applications to the App Store and to Google Play,
Develop and maintain Java/Kotlin/Objective-C/Swift Android and iOS modules,
Write unit and integration tests,
Prepare documentation for new and existing code,
Complete two week sprints and participate in sprint retrospectives and daily standup meetings,
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in computer science or software engineering, or equivalent experience,
1+ years of experience working with React Native,
2+ years of mobile application development experience,
Experience programming in Objective-C, Swift, Java, Kotlin, and especially JavaScript, TypeScript
Experience working with maps and location data is a plus,
A positive mindset and can-do attitude. This is very important to us,
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English),

mojow.ai provides equal employment opportunities regardless of, for example, race, religion, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Title: Junior Python Developer - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Rédigé au masculin pour alléger le texte
Poste nommé en interne Directeur Technique Adjoint (ATD)
La technologie de production est un terme général utilisé pour décrire le groupe de personnes qui soutiennent, développent et améliorent les outils et les technologies que les artistes utilisent pour créer nos films. Il s'agit des directeurs techniques de pipeline, des superviseurs de rendu, des superviseurs de pipeline et de la R&D.
En tant qu'assistant technique du pipeline, vous accomplirez diverses tâches et prêterez assistance aux Directeurs Techniques du Pipeline afin d’assurer le bon fonctionnement des outils, des logiciels et des flux de production utilisés dans nos projets primés d’effets visuels et de longs métrages d’animation. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les Directeurs Techniques du Pipeline afin d’offrir un soutien en personne aux artistes.
Nos talentueux Assistants techniques du pipeline possèdent une expertise technique poussée et sont passionnés d’innovation.
Tu devras régulièrement
Donner des conseils techniques et du soutien aux artistes
Contrôler la ferme de rendu, l’utilisation des disques et le transfert de fichiers entre les sites
Contribuer aux essais et recueillir les réactions concernant les nouvelles versions de logiciels de l’équipe de recherche et développement
Concevoir et rédiger des scripts et des outils Python à petite échelle qui seront utilisés dans les projets
En plus d’apprendre rapidement en cours d’emploi et de prendre des initiatives pour assumer des tâches techniques au besoin, vous devrez être un excellent communicateur. Votre capacité à communiquer des problèmes de façon précise et succincte avec les développeurs techniques et les artistes vous aidera à vous épanouir à ce poste.
Ce poste de premier échelon constitue une excellente occasion de développer vos compétences techniques et d’acquérir de l’expérience dans l’industrie des effets visuels. Vous serez exposés à toutes les étapes de notre pipeline et participerez à la production d’effets visuels et d’effets d’animation exceptionnels, en travaillant sur des projets variés allant des superproductions épiques aux émissions dramatiques.
Ce poste vous donne l’occasion de progresser au sein du département Pipeline de Double Negative en tant que Directeur Technique et Superviseur du Pipeline. Vous aurez éventuellement la possibilité de travailler dans différents services et spécialisations à l’échelle de l’entreprise.
Qualifications
Diplôme en informatique, en infographie ou dans un domaine connexe
Expérience avec Linux
Expérience avec Python
Atouts
Expérience de travail en effets visuels, en jeux ou dans un secteur connexe
Expérience avec divers progiciels DCC comme Houdini, Katana, Nuke et Clarisse
À propos de nous
Nous sommes DNEG, un des leaders mondiaux d'effets visuels, d'animation et de conversion stéréo pour des longs métrages et pour la télévision, avec des studios à Londres, Vancouver, Mumbai, Los Angeles, Chennai, Montréal, Chandigarh, Hyderabad et Goa.
-
This role is internally called Assistant Technical Director (ATD)
Production Technology is an umbrella term used to describe the group of people supporting, developing and improving the tools and technologies that artists use to create our films. These are Pipeline TDs, Rendering Supervisors, Pipeline Supervisors (Production Pipeline), and R&D.
As VFX Pipeline Technical Assistant you will perform a variety of tasks to assist the Pipeline TDs to ensure the smooth running of the tools, software, and workflows used on our award-winning VFX and Feature Animation shows. You will be working closely with the Pipeline TDs to provide face-to-face support for artists.
Our talented Pipeline Technical Assistant are highly technical and have an appetite for innovation.
You will be regularly required to
Provide technical advice and support for artists
Monitor render farm, disk usage and file transfers between sites
Contribute to testing and feedback for software releases from the R&D team
Design and write small-scale Python tools and scripts for shows to use
As well as being able to learn quickly on the job and use your aptitude for initiative to take on technical tasks when required, you will need to be an excellent communicator - your ability to accurately and succinctly communicate problems between technical developers and non-technical artists will help you thrive in this role.
This is a fantastic opportunity for you to develop your technical skills in an entry-level position and gain experience in the Visual Effects industry. You will be exposed to every step of our pipeline and will be involved in the production of exceptional VFX and animation work on projects ranging from blockbuster epics to television dramas.
This role opens up opportunities to progress through DNEG's Pipeline group as a Pipeline TD and Pipeline Supervisor, with potential opportunities in different specialisms and departments across the company.
Must have
A degree in Computer Science, Computer Graphics or related field
Experience with Linux
Experience with Python
Nice to have
Previous work experience in Visual Effects, Games or other related industry
Experience with a variety of DCC packages such as Maya, Houdini, Katana, Nuke or Clarisse
