At Utilismart, we build SaaS products for electrical and water utilities to help them manage their electric grid, analyze their massive amounts of data, and make informed business decisions.
We’re growing and looking for multiple software developers at intermediate and senior levels to join our team to help accelerate our product development, building and maintaining new and existing products in use by electrical utilities across North America.
This is currently a full-time remote position, open to anywhere within commuting distance of Windsor-Essex or London. The future is TBD but may include some in-office time for planning sessions, training early-career developers, occasional get-togethers, etc. Any in-office time would be in either London or Windsor-Essex, Ontario, whichever is most convenient for the team.
About You (Required)
· You have at least a couple years of experience building any kind of software (bonus if it’s using tech listed in the “Our Stack” section)
· You care about writing clean code, improving your craft, and creating value for users
· You can work effectively in a remote environment
· You are a generalist or are interested in becoming a generalist – it’s great to have strengths in specific areas, but we think it’s important to be able to work in a database, on the server-side, and on the client-side when needed
About You (Nice to Have)
· You have experience designing and architecting large features or entire systems from scratch, and seeing those designs through the implementation phase
· You know how to design and build applications that are fast and will scale when dealing with massive amounts of data
· You’re willing and capable of training and mentoring early-career developers
· You’re willing and capable of helping the team maintain high quality standards through code review, unit testing, etc.
Our Stack
We have multiple product lines, and are looking for the following technical skills. You don’t need all of these, but experience with some of these is an asset.
· C# .NET (.NET Framework as well as .NET Core)
· React
· Java
· PHP
· Oracle
· Kx for Sensors
· Mobile (Android/iOS)
· Git with Azure DevOps
Benefits
· Remote work (full time for now, the future TBD but at least part time remote forever)
· Funds for educational resources
· RRSP matching up to 6% of salary per year
· Annual bonuses and salary increases as part of performance review process
· Health and Dental plan
Please note as a condition of employment any applicants who receive a conditional offer of employment from Utilismart Corp. will be required to comply with the Utilismart Corp. Covid-19 Pandemic Guidelines and any future revisions.
Utilismart invites applications from all qualified individuals. Utilismart is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Aboriginal persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $70,000.00-$100,000.00 per year
Work remotely:
Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Android Developer - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Taking Root is looking for a mobile engineer to rapidly scale our technology and empower farmers around the world to fight climate change through agroforestry. This role would be responsible for developing new features for our mobile app, which is used to collect carbon data around the world. You will work closely with our data science team and reforestation team to ensure we are incorporating the best techniques to measure and monitor carbon captured through agroforestry.
This is a full-time position working with the head office in Vancouver, BC. Work is currently remote and we will consider highly qualified candidates for full-time remote work with up to 10% travel to Vancouver. Salary is competitive and based on experience.
About Taking Root and FARM-TRACE
Taking Root is an international social enterprise on a mission to regenerate the world’s tropical forests. We do this by developing highly impactful reforestation projects on behalf of brands to help them meet their climate commitments. Taking Root’s unique impact comes from our use of technology to direct companies’ climate investments into verified forest impacts with farmer groups. Our innovative technology platform, FARM-TRACE, provides third-party forest and carbon reporting by combining local and satellite data with machine learning. This means companies have the information they need to invest in reforestation with confidence while ensuring farmers get paid for the trees they grow. Taking Root is driving reforestation with leading multinational and environmental brands in 9 countries across all 3 tropical continents. Find out more about Taking Root and our technology platform, FARM-TRACE.
Responsibilities
:
Work with Product Manager, Lead Engineer, and our UX designer to scope new features
Solve complex problems for our customers who operate in challenging environments around the world
Work with our Reforestation and Data & Innovation teams to ensure our mobile data collection tools are using the latest carbon measurement methodologies
Prototype and build new functionality using the newest APIs and SDKs on the Android platform
Build innovative and intuitive features that users will love
Skills, Qualifications and Experience required
:
3+ years of experience developing in Android
Proficiency in Kotlin, Java. React and Python experience are pluses.
Ability to use the Android Studio, including the Android SDK, with ease.
Knowledge of Android design principles (e.g., coroutines and ViewModel) and application interface guidelines.
Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning, consuming RESTful API's, automated testing
Enjoys an environment that emphasizes communication and making other teammates better.
You are an ideal candidate if you are :
Has a passion for fighting climate change through reforestation and carbon removal
Experience working with geospatial applications is a plus
How to apply:
Submit a cover letter and resume by email. Please include "Android Developer" in the subject line. We value every application; however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.
Expected start date: 2021-12-15
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Title: RPG Developer - Remote - Indeed.com
Description:
A core function of the IT department within Core-Mark is to develop and support our suite of IBMi(AS400) applications, primarily the custom developed Distribution Center Management System (DCMS) and related interfaces. The DCMS is at the heart of the company in terms of Supply Chain, Warehouse Management, Customer Billing, Inventory, and interfaces with financial systems (SAP FICO and BW) and other custom and packaged systems.
The
RPG Developer
is responsible for developing, supporting and collaborating with other colleagues with the core responsibility of designing, programming, maintaining and testing applications on AS400 while supporting the wider company business.
Responsibilities
Thorough planning, documentation, business and process analysis, system configuration and reporting.
Assists in the delivery of project deadlines and schedules.
Assume responsibility for the quality of the code development process including design, performance, observing coding standards, code review and thorough testing.
Analyze and design computer systems with users
Program IBM i systems (RPG IV, RPG Free, RPGLE, CLLE)
Support users on systems
Troubleshoot system problems
Maintain current systems
Modify systems to conform with changes in company
Assist with modernization procedures
Develops conversion and system implementation plans; implements newly created code and fixes into existing software.
Provides programming support for various interfaces.
Work during normal business office hours; however may occasionally be required to provide after hours support when issues are encountered
Qualifications + Experience Required
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 5 years experience with IBMi (AS400)
Minimum of 5 years of experience utilizing RPG/LE/Free-format, CLLE Programming, IBMi/SQL including embedded SQL in RPGLE programs, DDL structure, and index structures.
Excellent hardware and software troubleshooting skills and experience in IBM Power systems (IBMi/iSeries/AS400).
Good understanding of EDI standards, XML, iDocs and other Data Exchange Technologies
Strong written communication skills including the ability to write business requirements, specifications and programming/configuration documentation.
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills – seasoned IT professional able to grasp the needs of the business operation, translate business needs into requirements and specifications and configure/program systems to create the needed results.
Highly organized to effectively manage multiple projects with competing priorities, and work independently.
Desired:
An understanding of wholesale distribution environments is a plus
Familiarity with IBM WebSphere MQ, IBM Rational Application Developer for WebSphere, Agile/Scrum development methodology, Object Oriented (OO) concepts and Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) would be a plus
Experience with Java, REST/SOAP API Web Services
Experience with MIMIX and/or other high-availability and disaster recover tools and processes in an IBMi environment is a plus
Experience with IBM Integration Bus (IIB) and the integration of custom built systems with packages is a plus

Title: Backend Developer Intern - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Backend Developer Intern
Montreal, QC
TouchTunes is a place where techies from all walks of life meet!
Our jukeboxes pioneer the future for digital music for business. We strive to stay ahead of the curve and push the boundaries of technology with our proactive and multidisciplinary approach to development.
Our Backend team is looking for new teammate who is an avid fan of Java development, and who possesses a keen interest in microservices and the cloud ️!
What your day-to-day looks like:
You will most likely help us resolve our Restful API challenges. You will do so by:
Participate in our daily scrum
Do code design discussion with the team
Code and most importantly, unit test your feature
Document your feature
Participate in code reviews
What you bring to the table:
You are currently in your final year of your bachelor, masters or Ph.D degree in Computer Science or any related field
Academic or personal experience with multiple object-oriented development languages such as Java, Python, etc.
Strong communication skills in French or English
Excellent analytical, organizational and problem solving skills
What’s an TT intern?
You will be cultivating and learning best practices in coding during the span of 4 months, full-time, in a fast-paced environment
You will also be mentored and coached by a team of experienced tech leads and team leads throughout your internship
You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to bring TT’s projects to life
You will have insight into your dream industry, network, grow your practical knowledge AND give you a competitive edge to join the team full-time after your graduation !
Développeur Backend Stagiaire
Montréal, QC
TouchTunes est un milieu où se rencontrent les technophiles de tous horizons!
Nos jukeboxes sont pionnières dans le domaine de la musique numérique pour les entreprises. Nous nous efforçons de rester à l'avant-garde et de repousser les limites de la technologie grâce à notre approche de développement proactive et multidisciplinaire.
Notre équipe Backend est à la recherche d'un nouveau coéquipier qui serait un grand fan du développement Java, et qui possède un intérêt marqué pour les microservices et le cloud ️ !
Votre quotidien ressemblera à ceci:
Vous nous aiderez à résoudre nos problèmes liés aux APIs Restful. Pour ce faire, vous devrez :
Participer à notre
scrum
quotidien.
Discuter de la conception du code avec l'équipe.
Coder et surtout, tester vos fonctionnalités.
Documenter vos fonctionnalités.
Participer aux révisions de code.
Ce que l’on recherche :
Vous êtes actuellement en dernière année du Bacc., de la Maîtrise ou du Doctorat en Science Informatique ou dans un domaine connexe.
Expérience académique ou personnelle avec plusieurs langages orientés objets tels que Java, Python etc.
Solides compétences en communication en français et en anglais.
Excellentes capacités d'analyse, d'organisation et de résolution de problèmes.
Pourquoi un stage chez TT ?
Pendant quatre mois à temps plein, vous apprendrez les meilleures pratiques de programmation dans un environnement dynamique.
Tout au long de votre stage, vous serez encadré par un mentor, une équipe de responsables techniques et de chefs d'équipe expérimentés.
Vous collaborerez avec des équipes multidisciplinaires pour donner vie aux projets de TT.
Vous aurez une vision de l’industrie dont vous rêvez. Vous pourrez vous constituer un réseau, développer vos connaissances pratiques ET aurez un avantage concurrentiel pour vous joindre à l'équipe à plein temps après l’obtention de votre diplôme !

Title: Javascript Developer - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Opportunity:
We are looking for a Javascript Developer to join our Agile team building the next generation cloud video intelligence solution. The product boasts a modern technology stack comprised of a cloud-ready Node.js server powering a React-based web app using REST APIs.
If you are passionate about technology, enjoy pushing boundaries, challenging the status quo, and looking to work on an engaging and fast-paced project, then we would love to hear from you!
Duties and Responsibilities:
Engage with the team to design and develop best-in-class features
Collaborate with cross-functional peers as we productize your work
Innovate as you research new technologies and solve complex problems
Support the team to resolve issues reported by our customers
Share well-developed product knowledge with peers, internal customers and new entrants into department
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or equivalent
Experience designing and developing scalable server-side applications in a microservices-based architecture using JavaScript/TypeScript (Node.js)
Experience in an Agile software development environment (SCRUM)
Experience with SQL databases such as PostgreSQL
Familiar with REST and gRPC
Familiar with HTTP and WebSocket
Familiar with web development using React JS
Experience with HTML5 and CSS
Familiar with object-oriented design and design patterns
Passionate about cloud technologies
Independent and willing to take initiative
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Assets:
NoSQL and/or time-series databases
GraphQL and/or SOAP
Networking and TCP/IP, UDP protocols
Cloud frameworks (AWS, GCP, Azure, OpenStack, etc.)
Experience building large, complex and multi-threaded applications designed for concurrency
March Networks is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse workforce.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Applicants can make their accommodation needs known to us in their application.
